intro: Diplotaxis varia, commonly known as the variable diplotaxis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the family Brassicaceae, which includes many economically important crops such as mustard and cabbage. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous annual with slender, branching stems and small, yellow flowers. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Diplotaxis varia is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in challenging climates.
